Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In 1975, The Sentry, a state-of-the-art Russian warship, was taken over by a rogue Soviet officer. This remarkable mutiny not only inspired the best-selling political thriller and the Sean Connery/Alec Baldwin blockbuster, "The Hunt for Red October," it almost triggered World War III.

Clip.Title: PHIL COLLINS: GOING BACK TO DETROIT
Clip.Episode: Phil Collins: Going Back to Detroit
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow Phil Collins back to the birthplace of Motown, as he joins the Funk Brothers for one soul-filled night of legendary music.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Little parts of our world disappear every day. Join host, Tom Cavanagh as learns what Smithsonian experts are doing to protect the best aspects of our world for future generations using "extreme conservation."

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: join host Tom Cavanagh (from TV's "Ed") as we explore the crime "scene" at the Smithsonian's Vaults: photographic evidence from the Crime of the Century; everyone's favorite natural villain, the snake; and America's first "Lone Gunman": John Wilkes Booth.

Clip.Episode: Phil Collins: Going Back to Detroit
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow Phil Collins back to the birthplace of Motown, as he joins the Funk Brothers for one soul-filled night of legendary music.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A journey along Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy coastline is a cultural and geological marvel - from historic Acadian Villages, to world-famous stone formations - rising from the sea.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

This remarkable mutiny not only inspired the best-selling political thriller and the Sean Connery/Alec Baldwin blockbuster, "The Hunt for Red October," it almost triggered World War III.

Clip.Title: PHIL COLLINS: GOING BACK TO DETROIT
Clip.Episode: Phil Collins: Going Back to Detroit
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow Phil Collins back to the birthplace of Motown, as he joins the Funk Brothers for one soul-filled night of legendary music.

Clip.Title: THE HUNT FOR BIN LADEN
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The inside story of the 20-year, billion dollar hunt for Osama bin Laden is revealed, featuring accounts from White House, intelligence, and military leaders involved in his capture.

Clip.Title: KENNEDY'S SUICIDE BOMBER
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Rare manuscripts, court documents and key eyewitnesses reveal the chilling and largely untold story of Richard Pavlick, who tried to kill President-Elect Kennedy in December 11th 1960, a month before Kennedy was sworn in as President.

Clip.Title: TIBET: MURDER IN THE SNOW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A Mountaineering Film Crew captures the shocking Murder of Tibetan refugees by the Chinese Military.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.Episode: Mongolia: A Country Swept By Winds
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Matriarch of a large Mongolian family of Nomads investigates and reflects on how the rapid changes in weather are impacting her country.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In the remote regions of North Quebec, the Inuit people are among the first on Earth to suffer from Climate Change.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet must perform surgery to save a dog with a groundbreaking operation to replace his foot with a prosthetic and a second dog with a dislocation.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the eastern tip of Papua New Guinea lies a marine paradise made up of 600 remote islands. These distant islands far offshore are surrounded by countless pristine coral reefs. Just beneath the sea - life abounds. With over 1,500 species of fish... every single nook and cranny on the reefs are inhabited and exploited.

Clip.Title: GREENPEACE: THE STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: As the world began to view the environmental damage caused by human beings, a determined group gathered in Vancouver to see what they could do about it and the result became the most recognizable group of environmental crusaders on Earth.

Clip.Title: BLACK MAMBA: KISS OF DEATH
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The bite of the black mamba is known by South African locals as the "kiss of death." A single strike can deliver enough neurotoxic venom to kill 15 grown men. It has one of Africa's worst reputations, but does it deserve its bad rap? Behind the bad press lies a mercurial reptile that is quite shy. Follow a female mamba looking for a home to incubate her eggs while avoiding her main enemy: humans. Then join snake bounty hunter Simon Keys, whose black mamba sanctuary offers a unique look at the secret behavior of this much-maligned snake.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet must perform surgery to save a dog with a groundbreaking operation to replace his foot with a prosthetic and a second dog with a dislocation.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the eastern tip of Papua New Guinea lies a marine paradise made up of 600 remote islands. These distant islands far offshore are surrounded by countless pristine coral reefs. Just beneath the sea - life abounds. With over 1,500 species of fish... every single nook and cranny on the reefs are inhabited and exploited.
